metadata.Title: CVE-2015-6245 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
epan/dissectors/packet-gsm_rlcmac.c in the GSM RLC/MAC dissector inWireshark 1.12.x before 1.12.7 uses incorrect integer data types, whichallows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) via acrafted packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6245` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
libwireshark11 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
libwiretap8 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
libwsutil9 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
tshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
wireshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
wireshark-common - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1').
